reviews.review: Great film. Proves that great film doesn't need to have happy ending.

With Endgame out today I thought I might as well write up a short review for Infinity War. This is the superhero film that all superhero films should mould themselves on. I've always enjoyed marvel films but I tend to put them in that albeit a bit patronising bracket of "It's good for what it is", but Infinity War is just a really, really, really good film. It benefits of course from all the interweaving stories from previous films; thus creating a sheer visual, action-packed treat, with the highest of stakes. 2 and a half hours flew by and it leaves you on one of the biggest, most shocking cliffhangers in movie history. Never has the buzz been bigger than it is for Endgame and Infinity War is my absolute favourite marvel movie, until maybe later tonight...
The best of the marvel series with a well crafted villain, it does a fair job at balancing its large cast of characters but their issues lie in the lack of significant development beforehand.
Incredible ending to the MCU just absolutely out of this world

It is absolutely mind blowing. Russos did something that has never been done before, and it works! I' ve seen the movie more than once, twice or even five times and it has never bored me. Thanos is the greatest villan ever created in the super hero movies.

Very mediocre. No plot twists, no surprises but just an objective throughout the entire movie. They even managed to make iron man uninteresting. Nothing of real substance other than the villain. Most interesting was how transparant the villain was with his feelings and conflicts.

I suppose I wont get the full picture until I have seen Endgame.

Avengers Infinity War is satisfying as it is electrifying. Been a year since its release, its really punching the core of action and comedy mixed together well with the versatile characters within the film. All in all, Infinity War is another Marvel spectacle that will be remembered for a lifetime.
